meaningMnemonic:
I must <kanji>say humbly</kanji> that I want to get <kanji>into</kanji> this position, so I'm planning <vocabulary>to apply</vocabulary> for it and <vocabulary>to submit an application</vocabulary>.

申し込む isn't just about applying, though. It's about officially communicating desires, whether you want <vocabulary>to propose</vocabulary> marriage, challenge someone to a game of tennis, or even offer a donation to a good cause.
readingMnemonic: The readings come from the word 申す and the kanji 込, stuck together... humbly.
